Anesthesiologists are experts in airway management and are on the front line of treatment of many patients with COVID-19; that is why they have to be prepared to protect themselves during airway handling. An analysis of over 70 thousand cases in China showed that 3.8% of individuals infected were health professionals, 14.8% of which considered severe, with five deaths reported.
41 Many lessons were learned with previous coronavirus epidemics and with recent experience with the SARS-CoV-2 pandemic in China and Italy. Given they are the most well-trained individuals to approach airways, anesthesiologists should also protect themselves appropriately while handling patients with COVID-19.
